content.description:
"Where's Vaino?" is the steep left-facing corner on the left side of Trout Rock.  This is a classic pitch of laybacking and stemming with solid moves from bottom to top.

Climb the corner to the 2-bolt anchor at the top.

The crux is a strenuous layback into a stem about 15' up.  I got in a yellow Alien and a #2 and #3 Camalot for pro.  Above, the climbing eases but is still interesting.  A second crux comes at the top of the corner where you exit right.  The last pro is a #1 Camalot down left and below your feet.

This pitch is comparable to Tough Situation on the Second Elephant Buttress and a bit easier and shorter than Cosmosis on Bell Buttress.  Well worth bringing a trad rack to Trout Rock!
content.protection: Gear to 3.5".  I placed pro from a green Alien to a #3.5 Camalot.  Two #2 Camalots were useful. 2-bolt anchor.

content.description: This is a dirty, mossy, loose crack system right of the rightmost bolted route.  On June 2, 2011, I led Dave Caha up this, as warm-up for the other routes here.  If it were cleaned, it would be better.
content.location: It is just right of the rightmost bolted route.

content.description:
Griffon goes up the left side of Trout Rock, just right of the left-facing corner "Where's Vaino?".

Climb steep rock to an overhang at the third bolt.  Surmount the overhang (crux), place a green Alien in a finger crack to the right, and continue to the 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts and an optional green Alien (.5"-.8" cam) placement after the third bolt (though the climbing eases then). 2-bolt anchor.

content.description:
Greenback climbs a steep slab near the center of Trout Rock, about 10' right of Cutthroat.

Climb past a neat hole in the rock by the first bolt and continue up the sustained thin face, using the crack and seam left of the bolts.  Lower from the 2-bolt anchor.

This is a great pitch with intricate and thoughtful climbing.

Cuthroat climbs a steep slab near the center of Trout Rock.  The route is about 25' right of Griffon and 10' left of Greenback.

Climb a short corner, placing a green Alien for pro, and work up to the first bolt.  Layback a thin edge to the second bolt.  Make some thin slab moves (crux) past the second bolt.  Continue up to the third bolt then angle right to the 2-bolt anchor shared with Greenback.  Lower.

You may want a directional piece (green or yellow Alien or #2 Camalot) above the third bolt before traversing to the 2-bolt anchor if your partner is going to top-rope the pitch.  The move past the third bolt is non-trivial, and there's a swing potential if they come off.
content.protection: A green Alien (".5-.8" cam) in the starting corner, then 3 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor shared with Greenback.
